channel.title: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off
channel.description:
Hi gents
When I started Whonix from VirtualBox and before it to start completely The power went out and my PC turned off suddenly Now My VMs (same disk, same folder) including Whonix Gateway and Workstation show as "inaccessible" Full scene: "Runtime error opening *(directory of the vm)* for reading:-38 (Access denied). /build/virtualbox-DqUp1P/virtualbox-6.1.26-dfsg/src/VBox/Main/src-server/MachineImpl.cpp[754] (nsresult Machine::i_registeredinit()) Result Code: NS_ERROR_FAILURE (0x80004005) Component: MachineWrap Interface: IMachine {85632c68-b5bb-4316-a900-5eb28d3413df}
Nothing can be done except refresh
Is it possible to get anything from them? I have some bookmarks in the browser
**Thanks In Advance**

item.title: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
You welcome, If it fails then use KVM instead of Vbox since you are using mint linux.

Read full topic

item.title: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix (downstream) isn’t producing VirtualBox. Oracle (upstream) When there are issues with the VirtualBox host software, in many cases very limited help can be provided downstream. Upstream might have better ideas.

Whonix – 26 Jan 22

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

ScratchedSkateboard:

"Runtime error opening (directory of the vm) for reading:-38 (Access denied).

Linux user permissions issue? Try Permission Fix. For non-Kicksecure:

Do not run this when logged in as root. Just echo to show the command it would run. If it makes sense, remove the echo. But before, make sure to have a backup for the whole disk to avoid doing further damage.

echo sudo chown --recursive $(whoami):$(whoami) /home/$(whoami)
ScratchedSkateboard:

The power went out and my PC turned off suddenly

Something file might have been corrupted on the host operating system.

  • Try a non-Kicksecure VM
  • VirtualBox Generic Bug Reproduction

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

ScratchedSkateboard:

Is it possible to get anything from them? I have some bookmarks in the browser

For data recovery… Even if the VM no longer starts, there’s a good chance the virtual hard drive file can be detached from that VM and that data can be recovered from the virtual hard disk file.

prerequisite knowledge is this chapter:
VirtualBox VMs Folder versus VirtualBox Settings Folder

You could try to move (or delete) the VirtualBox settings Folder. The VirtualBox VMs folder would still exist and contain the virtual hard drives. The VirtualBox hard drive could then be attached to a newly imported Whonix-Workstation.

The question is more about VirtualBox than Whonix. Do not rely on this forum to tell every step. It’s not required and it’s not efficient. By learning how to do it with any other VM = knowing how to do it for a Whonix VM.

What has a good chance - but data loss:

Kicksecure – 21 Dec 21

Kicksecure ™ Factory Reset

Resetting Kicksecure ™ to Vendor Defaults. Reset configuration files to defaults, re-install meta package, move the system closer to vendor defaults.

Read full topic
item.source: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off

item.title: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Kicksecure – 21 May 22

Kicksecure ™ in VirtualBox - Troubleshooting - Kicksecure ™ does not Start?

VT-x is disabled in the BIOS. / VERR_VMX_MSR_VMXON_DISABLED / VERR_SSM_FIELD_NOT_CONSECUTIVE / supR3HardenedWinReSpawn / Enable VT-x in BIOS / Aborted Status / Guru Mediation

Read full topic

item.title: (Still Unsolved)While taking off. The power went off. Now Whonix is always off
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
ScratchedSkateboard:

NS_ERROR_FAILURE

Kicksecure – 21 May 22

Kicksecure ™ in VirtualBox - Troubleshooting - Kicksecure ™ does not Start?

VT-x is disabled in the BIOS. / VERR_VMX_MSR_VMXON_DISABLED / VERR_SSM_FIELD_NOT_CONSECUTIVE / supR3HardenedWinReSpawn / Enable VT-x in BIOS / Aborted Status / Guru Mediation

Whonix VirtualBox - failed to start - NS_ERROR_FAILURE (0x80004005) - The VM session was aborted. VirtualBox
Edit by Patrick: Applies to all versions of Whonix VirtualBox: Whonix VirtualBox XFCE Whonix VirtualBox CLI Solution: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox/Troubleshooting#Failed_to_open_a_session_for_the_virtual_machine I just upgraded virtualbox to the latest version and now i cant start whonix VMs, all other VMs are working fine. I get this error… Failed to open a session for the virtual machine Whonix-Gateway/Workstation-CLI. The VM session was aborted. Result Code: NS_ERROR_FA…

Read full topic
